snippet.textDisplay:
I like to think that Castlevania 2 was a bit ahead of its time with the actionrpg genre.
 I got this got when i was 6 or 7 I think and at the time me and my brother spent hours and hours trying to figure out what to do. Sure it has some major flaws, like very bad translating and some bad gameplay mechanics, but the music and ambiance make up for it. 
To be honest, I even liked this better than Castlevania 1.
snippet.textOriginal:
I like to think that Castlevania 2 was a bit ahead of its time with the actionrpg genre.
 I got this got when i was 6 or 7 I think and at the time me and my brother spent hours and hours trying to figure out what to do. Sure it has some major flaws, like very bad translating and some bad gameplay mechanics, but the music and ambiance make up for it. 
To be honest, I even liked this better than Castlevania 1.

snippet.textDisplay: It's funny how the second game in a series was usually the black sheep during the NES/Gameboy era. I'm talking about very popular series of course, like Zelda, Castlevania, Mario, Metroid, Final Fantasy, Dragon Quest. There are some exceptions of course... like Megaman 2. :P
snippet.textOriginal: It's funny how the second game in a series was usually the black sheep during the NES/Gameboy era. I'm talking about very popular series of course, like Zelda, Castlevania, Mario, Metroid, Final Fantasy, Dragon Quest. There are some exceptions of course... like Megaman 2. :P
